Dermal Fillers

Dermal fillers are compounds containing hyaluronic acid, a natural compound that restores volume and fullness to your face and also diminishes facial lines.

Hyaluronic acid attracts water and maintains your skin’s water volume so you achieve the look of greater hydration and fullness almost immediately.

You might seek treatment with dermal fillers to:

  • Plump your lips
  • Soften creases, folds, and wrinkles around your eyes, nose, and mouth
  • Add volume to hollowed cheeks
  • Lift sagging skin
  • Reduce the look of aging under the eyes

Dermal fillers address the natural loss of subcutaneous facial fat that occurs as you age. As you lose this fat, the muscles of your face are closer to the skin's surface, making wrinkles and expression lines stand out more. Because the treatment is noninvasive, you have no blood loss.

Injectable aesthetics fillers can help provide a more youthful look for a fraction of what a traditional facelift costs. Aesthetics fillers add volume and fill lines and wrinkles in less than 30 minutes. Injectable aesthetics fillers fill the lines, creases, and volume loss areas with one of several different substances. As a result, trouble spots nearly disappear. Cosmetic fillers are used as “volumizers,” plumping and lifting cheeks, jawlines, and temples; filling out thin lips, and plumping sagging hands. The treatment is fast and easy.

Hyaluronic acid is a key ingredient in a family of injectable fillers that has revolutionized the in-office treatment of deeper wrinkles. A variety of products are available (JUVÉDERM, Stylage, Restylane, Revanesse.), each with its own advantages.
